name: Talent Tradition
description:
Psionic abilities are grouped into categories according to their effects, with each category comprising one of many talent traditions.
You choose a talent tradition from the following options: chronopathy, telekinesis, or telepathy. Your talent tradition is your subclass, and your choice of tradition determines many of the features you’ll gain as you gain new levels. (Other talent traditions will be featured in future products.) (Quick Build: Telekinesis.)

options.description: Chronopathy abilities allow you to view future and past events, and to manipulate time to aid allies and hinder foes.
Telekinesis abilities allow you to physically manipulate creatures and objects.
Telepathy abilities allow you to communicate with, read, and influence the minds of other creatures.

name: Clarity and Strain
description: Clarity is the psionic energy you gather to reshape thoughts, matter, and time. You build it as battles unfold and spend it to empower your abilities.

in_combat.name: Clarity in Combat
in_combat.description: At the start of each of your turns during combat, roll 1d3 and gain that much clarity. The first time each combat round that any creature is force moved, you gain 1 clarity. You lose any remaining clarity at the end of the encounter.

out_of_combat.name: Clarity Outside of Combat
out_of_combat.description:
Though you can't gain clarity outside of combat, you can use your heroic abilities and effects that cost clarity without spending it. Whenever you use an ability or effect outside of combat that costs clarity, you can't use that same ability or effect outside of combat again until you earn 1 or more Victories or finish a respite.

Additionally, whenever you use any ability or effect that costs clarity within 1 minute of using another such ability, you take 1d6 damage and incur any strain effect from using the new ability.
When you use an ability outside of combat that lets you spend unlimited clarity on its effect, such as Minor Telekinesis, you can use it as if you had spent an amount of clarity equal to your Victories.

strain.name: Strain
strain.description: You can overspend clarity, allowing it to drop below 0. When you resolve an ability that leaves you with negative clarity, you take damage equal to the clarity you overspent and become strained until your clarity is 0 or higher. While strained, any psionic ability that lists a strained effect also triggers that entry when you use the ability.

name: Mind Spike
description: You have the following ability, which can be used as a ranged free strike.

name: Telepathic Speech
description: You know the Mindspeech language (see Languages in Orden in Chapter 4: Background). Additionally, you can telepathically communicate with any creatures within distance of your Mind Spike ability if they share a language with you and you know of each other. When you communicate with someone this way, they can respond telepathically.

name: Tradition Features
description: Your talent tradition grants you two features, as shown on the 1st-Level Tradition Features table.

grants.name: Accelerate
grants.description: You have the following ability.

grants.name: Again
grants.description: You have the following ability.

grants.name: Minor Telekinesis
grants.description: You have the following ability.

grants.name: Repel
grants.description: You have the following ability.

grants.name: Feedback Loop
grants.description: You have the following ability.

grants.name: Remote Assistance
grants.description: You have the following ability.

name: Tradition Feature
description: Your tradition unlocks an additional feature at 2nd level.

grants.name: Ease the Hours
grants.description: You can increase the number of rounds in a montage test by 1 if the test would end before the heroes hit the success limit.

grants.name: Ease Their Fall
grants.description: Whenever you land after a fall, or if any falling creature lands within 2 squares of you, you can use a free triggered action to reduce the falling damage by an amount equal to 2 + your Reason score.

grants.name: Ease the Mind
grants.description: You gain an edge on tests made to stop combat and start a negotiation. Additionally, if you are present during a negotiation, any NPC who has a hostile or suspicious starting attitude has their patience increased by 1 (to a maximum of 5).

name: Scan
description: You can extend your psionic senses beyond their usual range. Once on each of your turns, you can search for hidden creatures as a free maneuver (see Hide and Sneak in Chapter 9: Tests). Additionally, once you establish line of effect to a thinking creature within distance of your Mind Spike ability, you always have line of effect to that creature until they move beyond that distance.

name: Mind Projection
description:
As a maneuver, you project your mind outside your body. While you are in this state, your body remains unconscious and prone, and your mind is a separate entity with size 1T. Your mind automatically has concealment, and can freely move through solid matter. If you end your turn inside solid matter, you are forced out into the space where you entered it.

Any abilities or features you use originate from your mind. Both your mind and your body can take damage while separated, with any such damage applied to your Stamina. Your mind is instantly forced back into your body if you take any damage, and you can immediately return to your body as a free maneuver.

name: Mind Recovery
description:
Whenever you spend a Recovery to regain Stamina while strained, you can forgo the Stamina and gain 3 clarity instead.

Additionally, the first time each combat round that a creature is force moved, you gain 2 clarity instead of 1.

name: Suspensor Field
description:
You can fly. While flying, your stability is reduced to 0 and can't be increased. If you can already fly, you have a +2 bonus to speed while flying instead.

If you are strained while flying and are force moved, the forced movement distance gains a +2 bonus.

name: Tradition Feature
description: Your talent tradition grants you two features, as shown on the 5th-Level Tradition Features table.

grants.name: Distortion Temporal
grants.description: While you are not dying, time behaves irregularly around you in a 3 aura. That area is difficult terrain for enemies. Additionally, when an ally enters the area for the first time in a combat round or starts their turn there, they gain a +2 bonus to speed until the end of the turn.

grants.name: Speed of Thought
grants.description: Once per combat round while you are not dying, you can spend 2 clarity when you use a triggered action to turn it into a free triggered action.

grants.name: Kinetic Amplifier
grants.description: Whenever you force move a creature, you can spend up to 2 surges. For each surge spent, the forced movement distance gains a bonus equal to your Reason score.

grants.name: Triangulate
grants.description: Whenever an ally uses a ranged ability while you are within the ability's distance, you can spend 1 clarity as a free triggered action to allow them to use the ability as if they were in your space.

grants.name: Compulsion
grants.description: Whenever you obtain a success on a test using a skill from the interpersonal skill group while interacting with an NPC, you can ask them a question using your Telepathic Speech feature. The NPC must answer the question truthfully to the best of their ability.

grants.name: Remote Amplification
grants.description: The distance of your ranged psionic abilities increases by 5. Additionally, the range of your Telepathic Speech feature increases to 1 mile.

name: Psi Boost
description: Whenever you use an ability that is a main action or a maneuver with the Psionic keyword, you can spend additional clarity to apply a psi boost to it and enhance its effects. A psi boost’s effects only last until the end of the turn which the ability is first used. You can apply multiple psi boosts to an ability, but only one instance of each specific boost. You can use the following psi boosts.

name: Ancestral Memory
description: Each time you finish a respite, you can choose a number of skills you have up to your Reason score and replace them with an equal number of skills from the interpersonal and lore skill groups. These replacements last until the end of your next respite.

name: Cascading Strain
description: Whenever you take damage from a strained effect or from having negative clarity, you can choose one enemy within distance of your Mind Spike ability to take the same damage.

name: Lucid Mind
description: At the start of each of your turns during combat, you gain 1d3 + 1 clarity instead of 1d3.

name: Tradition Feature
description: Your tradition continues to evolve at 8th level.

grants.name: Doubling the Hours
grants.description: While you have 5 or more Victories, you can undertake an additional respite activity during a respite.

grants.name: Stasis Shield
grants.description: You have the following ability.

grants.name: Levitation Field
grants.description: You have the following ability.

grants.name: Low Gravity
grants.description: Your mind can carry your body through tough times. You ignore difficult terrain and don’t need to spend additional movement while prone.

grants.name: Mindlink
grants.description: Whenever you obtain a success on a test using a skill from the interpersonal skill group while interacting with an NPC, you can ask them a question using your Telepathic Speech feature. The NPC must answer the question truthfully to the best of their ability.

grants.name: Universal Connection
grants.description: The range of your Telepathic Speech feature increases to anywhere on the same world.

name: Fortress of Perfect Thought
description:
Your mind is an impenetrable palace that shields you from danger. You gain the following effects:

- You can breathe even when there is no breathable air.
- You have psychic immunity 10.
- Creatures can't read your thoughts unless you allow them to.
- Your Reason and Intuition are treated as 2 higher for the purpose of resisting the potency of abilities.
- You can't be made taunted or frightened.

name: Clear Mind
description: The first time each combat round that a creature is force moved, you gain 3 clarity instead of 2.

name: Omnisensory
description: You have a +10 bonus to the distance of your ranged abilities. Additionally, you don't need line of effect to a target of a ranged ability if the target is a creature capable of thought who you have previously had line of effect to.

name: Psion
description:
At the start of each of your turns during combat, you gain 1d3 + 2 clarity instead of 1d3 + 1.

Additionally, you can choose to not take damage from having negative clarity. You can also choose to take on any ability's strained effect even if you're not strained.

name: Vision
description:
You have an epic resource called vision. Each time you finish a respite, you gain vision equal to the XP you gain. You can spend vision on your abilities as if it were clarity.

Additionally, you can spend vision to use one additional psionic ability on your turn, provided you pay the entire cost of the ability in vision. If you choose to use a psionic ability that usually costs no clarity, you must spend 1 vision to use it.
Vision remains until you spend it.
